title.narrative: Survey Research in Central America: Working Conditions, Health, Discrimination and Violence

description.narrative: To collect original data on the prevalence, nature, and possible effects on workers of a variety of working conditions and health issues, including work-related and gender-based violence, through a national household survey and focus groups in six country partners under the Central America Free Trade Agreement (CAFTA-DR)

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Labor, Departmental Management, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Office of Trade and Labor Affairs (OTLA) - Labor Market Supply and Demand in the Northern Triangle

description.narrative: This project assists foreign governments and industry leaders in El Salvador, Honduras, and Guatemala to publish reliable and comprehensive labor market information for the general public and increases the skill and knowledge of educational and workforce development programs, employers, and policy makers on how to best use the data. The public will have greater knowledge of certain sectors that are in need of workers, which skills they need, and which entities can provide training. Tourism is the pilot sector focusing on hotels and lodging for all 3 countries.

title.narrative: Preventing and Reducing Child Labor and Forced Labor in Palm Oil Supply Chains

description.narrative: This project works to improve the implementation of social compliance systems that promote acceptable conditions of work and the prevention and reduction of child and forced labor in palm oil supply chains in Colombia and Ecuador. It will also disseminate best practices in social compliance systems in these and other palm oil producing countries, particularly Brazil and Peru.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Increasing Collective Action to Address Child Labor, Forced Labor, and Other Unacceptable Conditions of Work in El Salvador, Guatemala, and Honduras

description.narrative: The project will work with civil society and workers' organizations in El Salvador, Guatemala, and Honduras to strengthen their capacity and bolster their collaboration with government agencies, the private sector and other stakeholders to protect labor rights and reduce child labor and forced labor. The project will focus on organizations that represent indigenous, Afro-descendant, and Garifuna populations, while promoting gender and racial equity.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Office of Child Labor, Forced Labor, and Human Trafficking (OCFT)

description.narrative: Theproject will help to increase collective action by workers organizations (WOs) and civil society organizations (CSOs) to address forced labor, child labor, and other labor violations in cattle raising areas of Brazil and Paraguay, specifically in the Brazilian State of Mato Grosso do Sul and in the Paraguayan Department of Boquern in the Chaco region.
